group.name: Maranantha-Alkahest
group.comment:
Maranantha-Alkahest is copyright 1981 by Judges Guild.

The sector was written by Dave Sering, with Cover by Ken Simpson,
Graphics and Layout by Jerry Taylor and Rick Houser, and Art by
Ed Perry. Bob Bledsaw (judgesguild@q-com.com) gave permission
for this sector to be transcribed into Galactic.

The transcription was done by Robin Ludbey (rludbey@ozemail.com.au)
August 1998.

group.name: Blackedge
group.comment:
Blackedge Subsector
-------------------
The Blackedge Subsector is located in the Lesser Rift, and what administrative
services are available are provided by the Supraherd T'tnaree through Kashgar
in the Kma Subsector. The Imperium maintains only a loose surveillance of the
area and occasionally subsidises an observer on the T'tnaree scout patrols. A
notable navigational hazard exists in the Spinstorme System which discourages
navigation in this area.


The Blackedge Subsector contains 9 systems with a total population of 24.7
million.
The highest Population Level is 7, at Pitch, Lurid, and Trom.
The highest Tech Level is 8, at Trom.

group.name: Kma
group.comment:
Kma Subsector
-------------
The Kma Subsector contains the most significant portion of Supraherd T'tnaree,
the Capital being located at Barkhatu. Seven Non-aligned systems are to the
Spinward and Rimward borders. Humaniti comprise less than 25% on almost all of
the planets. The population is comprised of a mixture of various sapients, and
no one species attains dominance. Little conflict of a military nature has
taken place in this Subsector, though a great deal of commercial activity is
prominent. 


The Kma Subsector contains 23 systems with a total population of 288.8 million.
The highest Population Level is 9, at Merket.
The highest Tech Level is E at Barkhatu.

group.name: Taranaki
group.comment:
Taranaki Subsector
------------------
The Taranaki Subsector contains portions of Supraherd T'tnaree, Maorin Stat,
and two systems of Range Valyana, as well as five Non-aligned systems. This
area has, in the past, been the scene of much commercial rivalry and a lot of
small scale armed confrontation. An equitable commercial treaty was agreed to
by all three parties more than a century and a half ago. At one time in the
past Jalpan was a noted freebooter stronghold.


The Taranaki Subsector contains 31 Systems with a total population of 27
billion.
The highest Population Level is A at Zilling.
The highest Tech Level is D, at Clutha.

group.name: Otago
group.comment:
Otago Subsector
---------------
The Otago Subsector is comprised primarily of systems belonging to the Maorin
Stat, although 9 systems are Non-aligned. The Capital of the Stat is located
at Okata in this Subsector. The political and military history has been
relatively quiet and concerned primarily with slow and steady commercial
expansion. Much commercial traffic crosses this Subsector to and from the Two
Thousand Worlds.
 

The Otago Subsector contains 33 systems with a total population of 232.5
million.
The highest Population Level is 9, at Okato, Tauroa, and Ommen.
The highest Tech Level is D at Okato.

group.name: Skelmore
group.comment:
Skelmore Subsector
------------------
The Skelmore Subsector is comprised entirely of systems of the Lesser Rift
which has an extremely low star density. All systems in this region are
Non-aligned, and several are still undeveloped. What administrative services
are available are located at Qadhima in the Ralmar Subsector immediately to
Rimward.


The Skelmore Subsector contains 9 systems with a total population of 11.2
million.
The highest Population Level is 7, at Xcalak.
The highest Tech Level is 9, at Loxicha.

group.name: Khali
group.comment:
Khali Subsector
---------------
The Khali Subsector is one-third Lesser Rift with all of three Non-aligned
systems, one-third Zultan Al Amyi with six systems, and one-third Range Valyana
with nine systems. This sparsely populated area has been the scene of a number
of border clashes between Rangan and Zultani. Building tensions indicate that
there will soon be another war. The Rangan will hold it dearly, as it contains
one of their Tri Capitals, and hope for their allies to counter-attack and
relieve the pressure.
 

The Khali Subsector contains 18 systems with a total population of 1.2 million.
The highest Population Level is 6, at Sinchu, Swatow, and Chinsi. 
The highest Tech Level is C, at Swatow.

group.name: Szechwin
group.comment:
Szechwin Subsector
------------------
The Szechwin Subsector is occupied by Range Valyana. This area contains the Tri
Capitals, Pachungi and Tehko. Owing to the mobile lifestyle of the Valyana,
population levels have never become very high. The Subsector also contains
seven Non-aligned systems. Considerable merchant traffic flows through this
region from Ramayan, K'Chemi Centralate, and the Einarchy to the Maorin Stat
and Supraherd T'tnaree. Not threatened by overt war, this area has,
nonetheless, seen a build-up of security forces since there have been a
disturbing number of ship disappearances in the last several years.


The Szechwin Subsector contains 21 systems with a total population of 750.4
million.
The highest Population  Level is 9 at Pachungi.
The highest Tech level is E, also at Pachungi.

group.name: Midormega
group.comment:
Midormega Subsector
-------------------
The Midormega Subsector is primarily an unorganised area on the fringes of
several small interstellar states. Density of star systems is rather low and
has retarded development in this Subsector. There still remains a fairly high
incidence of piracy in this area; a hidden base is suspected in the Subsector.
Stasmi Zanya, a very recent political organisation, overlaps this Subsector
into the T'shemi Subsector. Commercial opportunities abound as development
increases in this area.


The Midormega Subsector contains 22 systems with a total population of 17.5
million.
The highest Population Level is 7, at Twello and Doesburg.
The highest Tech Level is 9, at Mezotur and Kaposvar.

group.name: Ralmar
group.comment:
Ralmar Subsector
----------------
The Ralmar Subsector has all but three of the systems herein contained within
the Zultan Al Amyi. This area of the Zultanate has been the scene of several
conflicts with the Sydymic Empire to Spinward. Internal dissension has also
been frequent, led by either Shaqra or Qadhima. At the present time, sentiment
in the Spinward regions of the Zultanate matches that of its other regions:
that of a building desire for a crusade of renewal.


The Ralmar Subsector contains 30 systems with a total population of 1.15
billion.
The highest Population Level is 9, at Sakaka, and Qadhima.
The highest Tech Level is D, at Saqra and Qadhima.

group.name: Tuwaiq
group.comment:
Tuwaiq Subsector
----------------
The Tuwaiq Subsector was the scene of heavy armed fighting during the War of
Einarchy Independence and still remains a hotbed of tensions. Moet of the
systems remain in Zultani hands with heavy naval forces shuttling back and
forth along the border. The Einarchy maintains heavy patrol forces at Aytos
with scouts out at Haleb and Raqqa. Ramayan has a heavy fleet based at Bastar
with scouts at Khabur. It is suspected that the Zultanate will try to retake
the Einarchy, though the precise date and place of attack are uncertain.


The Tuwaiq Subsector contains 32 systems with a total population of 5.15
billion.
The highest Population Level is A, at Sa'diya.
The highest Tech level is D, at Samarra.

group.name: Sudin
group.comment:
Sudin Subsector
---------------
The Sudin Subsector was the site of much fighting during the War of Einarchy
Independence. Since that time, the Subsector has seen an unprecedented period
of peace and commercial prosperity. Trade has increased remarkably, and the
bordering interstellar states have been able to greatly reduce their naval
forces in this area. Twelve systems belong to the Einarchy, two to Range
Valyana, three to Ramayan, four to K'Chemi Centralate, and eight are
Non-aligned. All states in this area are reinforcing their naval forces in
anticipation of trouble with the Zutani.


The Sudin Subsector contains 29 systems with a total population of 167.4
million.
The highest Population Level is 8, at Varna, Puri, Tatung, and Enugu.
The highest Tech level is D, at Varna.

group.name: T'Shemi
group.comment:
T'Shemi Subsector
-----------------
The T'Shemi Subsector contains elements of the interstellar states K'Chemi
Centralate, Stasmi Zanya, and Taquari' Comnate, as well as eight Non-aligned
systems. Commercial rivalries in this area have been, and remain, intense, but
only rarely have armed skirmishes broken out. Over the past several centuries,
new trade routes have been established to Stasmi Zanya to service the growing
chemo-synthetic industries there.

The T'Shemi Subsector contains 33 systems with a total population of 2.57
billion.
The highest Population Level is 9, at Cham, Nyanga, and Carlin.
The highest Tech level is D, at Cham and N'Dogo.

group.name: Yakilnet
group.comment:
Yakilnet Subsector
------------------
The Yakilnet Subsector is primarily an open area in independent star-systems
with Zultan Al Amyi claiming nine systems at the Coreward edge. These systems
include the political Capital of the Zutani, Bafq. Sphere Fenix and the Marlan
Primate, as well as the Sydymic Empire have blocked expansion efforts in this
direction. Military vessels have been sighted in this area of late. This area
also is liable to be in contention when next the Zultani move.
 

The Yakilnet Subsector contains 25 systems with a total population of 844.6
million.
The highest Population Level is 9, at Bafq.
The highest Tech level is B, at Bafq.

group.name: Dawes
group.comment:
Dawes Subsector
---------------
The Dawes Subsector is split between the Ramayan and the Zultani Al Amyi.
Considerable fighting has taken place in the center of this Subsector, and the
Ramayan generally come out on top. Tensions are again increasing, and it is
anticipated that the Zultani will try to attack yet again.


The Dawes Subsector contains 28 systems with a total population of 13.7
billion.
The highest Population Level is A, at Belgaum and Hubli.
The highest Tech Level is C at Meerut and Nagercoil.

group.name: Induz
group.comment:
Induz Subsector
---------------
The Induz Subsector contains a large portion of Ramayan and also eight
Non-aligned systems. These were the first systems settled by the Ramayan and
were not involved in any of the Zultani raids. Nevertheless, large military
forces are still maintained as a matter of policy.


The Induz Subsector contains 28 systems with a total population of 5.7 billion.
The highest Population Level is A, at Emis and Multan.
The highest Tech Level is D, at Sukkur.

group.name: Hlantae
group.comment:
Hlantae Subsector
-----------------
The Hlantae Subsector contains eight systems of the Taquari' Comnate, two
systems of the K'Chemi Centralate, and twelve Non-aligned systems. Much
commercial competion goes on in this area, and a group of four Non-aligned
systems have formed a trade league to help them compete.


The Hlantae Subsector contains 22 systems with a total population of 1.03
billion.
The highest Population Level is 9, at Tg'Nara.
The highest Tech Level is E, at Tg'Dosso.

system.name: Shade
system.comment:
<html> <head>
</head> <body> </body> </html>

system.name: Spinstorme
system.comment:
World: Spinstorme
Subsector: Blackedge
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 0506 (A0506)
UWP: X200000--

Allegiance: Undeveloped
Trade Codes: None
Travel Zone: Green

The Spinstrome system is composed of a Binary star with a Black Hole and poses
a significant Navigational Hazard.

system.name: Lurid
system.comment:
World: Lurid
Subsector: Blackedge
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 0708 (A0708)
UWP: C000789-8

Allegiance: Non-aligned
Trade Codes: As              
Travel Zone: Green

Mining is the major occupation of the population here.

system.name: Kashgar
system.comment:
World: Kashgar
Subsector: Kma
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 1205 (B0405)
UWP: A355789-B

Allegiance: Supraherd T'tnaree
Bases: Navy
Trade Codes: Ag              
Travel Zone: Green

A regional administrative center of Supraherd T'tnaree, this planet also serves 
as administrative center for the Blackedge Subsector. This 5200 kilometer
diameter planet is the fourth in a system of ten. The inner three orbital
positions are occupied by planets with statistics of X100000--, X411000--, and
E522312-A. The third planet, Kintron, is a mining colony of Kashgar. The fifth
and sixth positions are occupied by minor rocks of less than 1500 km diameter.
Seventh position is an asteroid belt. Eighth and ninth positions are Gas Giants
and the tenth is a frozen rock, stats X410000--.
The population of Kashgar is primarily Tzee-tch, a minor alien of gatherer
descent. Through a special arrangement, this planet was settled in 438 Imperial
with only the Tzee-tch. Though populations increased, and settlements spread
over much of the equatorial belt, the colony was not considered a complete
success. In 843, arrangements were made with the central government to permit
other species of sapients to settle here as well. In the intervening three
centuries, Humaniti, Vargr, and other races have settled here, forming the
nuclei of four cities and upgrading the spaceport. Two centuries ago, a naval
base was established here during a period of heavy Zutani commerce raids.
Agriculture is still the main industry, though an expanded mining program is
contemplated.

system.name: Barkhatu
system.comment:
World: Barkhatu
Subsector: Kma
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 1602 (B0802)
UWP: A7898A9-E

Allegiance: Supraherd T'tnaree
Bases: Navy
Trade Codes: Cx              
Travel Zone: Green

The Capital of the Supraherd T'tnaree is located on Barkhatu.

system.name: Okata
system.comment:
World: Okata
Subsector: Otago
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 2505 (D0105)
UWP: A575997-D

Allegiance: Maorin Stat
Bases: Navy
Trade Codes: Cx              
Travel Zone: Green

A major member of the Maorin Stat, the moderately-sized world occupies an
important site on a major internal communications route. It is the third planet
in a system of eight. The inner two planets are minor rocks of less than 2000
km diameter. The fourth planet is named Kirato, stats E732320-B, and is a
mining colony of Okato. The fifth planet is another minor rock less than 2000
km in diameter. The sixth planet is a large Gas Giant with a refuelling station
on the third of its nine minor satellites. The seventh and eighth planets are
minor rocks of less than 1500 km diameter.
The major portion of the population is Humaniti of Solomani descent which first
colonised this planet in -1804 Imperial. The next ten centuries were occupied
in slowly building up population and accommodating other minor refugee
movements. In -746 Imperial, Okata was subjected to a terrorist bioweapon
attack which killed 25% of the population. As a result of this disaster, Okata
built greatly increased defences and began a program of political unification.
Inside of four centuries, Okato had become the capital of the Maorin Stat
which, at that time. comprised over 20 systems. Ten more systems joined in the
next four centuries. In the span from Imperial 100 to date, expansion has
slowed, with only seven more systems joining. Many different cultures and races
have been accommodated in Maorin Stat, though most are either Solomani or
Vilani Humaniti. Okato today is the center of a thriving commercial traffic.
Trade among members of Maorin Stat is extensive, and Maorin merchants range
widely among the other interstellar states in the surrounding Subsectors.

system.name: Swatow
system.comment:
World: Swatow
Subsector: Khali
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 1514 (F0704)
UWP: A855678-C

Allegiance: Range Valyana
Bases: Navy
Trade Codes: Cx              
Travel Zone: Green

Swatow is one of the Three Capitals of the Range Valyana, each of which serve
as the Supreme Capital in turn.

The other two Capitals are located at Pachungi (1916) and Tehko (2011) both in
the Szechwin Subsector.

system.name: Aicheng
system.comment:
World: Aicheng
Subsector: Khali
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 1617 (F0807)
UWP: C54A478-A

Allegiance: Range Valyana
Bases: Scout Base
Trade Codes: Ni Wa           
Travel Zone: Green

The Valyans consider this system to be one of the major defensive bulwarks
against Zultani raids and station a heavy patrol squadron here. This 8500 km
diameter waterworld is the second planet in a system of six. The inner planet
is an airless rock, stats X400000--. The third is a desert world, E330100-8,
maintained as a communications station and emergency landing field. The fourth
and fifth planets are minor rocks under 1500 kilometers diameter. The last
planet is a Gas Giant with a minor refuelling base on the fourth of its eleven
moons.
While maintained as a Scout base for nearly ten centuries, this world had not
previously been colonised. A century ago, a religious group applied for
permission to settle the planet. Their numbers, as yet, are still small, but
the population is spread across the surface of the entire planet. The people
are organised in small, nomadic, tribal units based upon ships or rafts. Each
unit is a political entity unto itself, and no real conflict exists between
them. The population has periodic "fairs" or gatherings at the Scout base.
Additional colonists arrive from time to time, but little expansion of the
program is planned. The system also serves as a refuelling stop and has an
orbital refuelling station in geosynchronous orbit above the Scout base.

system.name: Pachungi
system.comment:
World: Pachungi
Subsector: Szechwin
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 1916 (G0306)
UWP: A7799A4-E

Allegiance: Range Valyana
Bases: Navy
Trade Codes: Cx              
Travel Zone: Green

Pachungi is one of the Three Capitals of the Range Valyana, each of which serve
as the Supreme Capital in turn.

The other two Capitals are located at Swatow (1514) in the Khali Subsector and
Tehko (2011) in the Szechwin Subsector.

system.name: Tehko
system.comment:
World: Tehko
Subsector: Szechwin
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 2011 (G0401)
UWP: A8797A7-C

Allegiance: Range Valyana
Bases: Navy
Trade Codes: Cx              
Travel Zone: Green

Tehko is one of the Three Capitals of the Range Valyana, each of which serve as
the Supreme Capital in turn.

The other two Capitals are located at Swatow (1514) in the Khali Subsector and
Pachungi (1916) in the Szechwin Subsector.

system.name: Mikinai
system.comment:
World: Mikinai
Subsector: Szechwin
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 2414 (G0804)
UWP: E551443-4

Starport: Frontier Quality
Size: Medium (7200-8800 km)
Atmosphere: Thin
Hydrographics: 10% water
Population: 60,000
Govt: Representative Democracy
Law Level: Low
Technology: Industrial
Planetoid Belts: 1
Gas Giants: 0

Allegiance: Non-aligned
Bases: None
Trade Codes: Ni Po           
Travel Zone: Green

system.name: Rabigh
system.comment:
World: Rabigh
Subsector: Ralmar
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 0624 (I0604)
UWP: C331659-8-M

Allegiance: Zultanate Al Amyi
Trade Codes: Ni De           
Travel Zone: Green

The second planet out in a system of five, Rabigh is a small, but typical,
member of the Zultan Al Amyi. The innermost planet is a bare rock of 1800
kilometers diameter; the third orbital position is occupied bay an asteroid
belt, and the fourth and fifth positions are occupied by Gas Giants with 7 and
9 small satellites, respectively.
This 5400 km diameter planet has most of its population spread out in the
sub-arctic forest belts where the primary occupation is ranching and herding.
Industries are concentrated around the small city which maintains the spaceport.
A second, much smaller city exploits a number of mineral deposits. The planet
was settled during the first wave of the migration and achieved a Population
Level of 8 in three centuries. As more desirable planets were developed, much
of the population migrated again. At the present time, major exports are
certain rare earth elements for electronic components and refined
pharmaceutical raw materials. The technical clans settled at the starport and
mining town, dominate the ruling clans, and control all trade.

system.name: Varna
system.comment:
World: Varna
Subsector: Sudin
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 1725 (K0105)
UWP: A557855-D

Allegiance: Kmyi Einarchy
Bases: Navy
Trade Codes: Cx              
Travel Zone: Green

The Capital of the Kmyi Einarchy is located here.

system.name: T'Batak
system.comment:
World: T'Batak
Subsector: Sudin
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 1826 (K0206)
UWP: X456679-3

Allegiance: Krmyi Einarchy
Trade Codes: Na Ni           
Travel Zone: Amber

Commerce with this world is restricted. It was originally settled as a slave
farm by the Zultani in 521 Imperial. The Krmyia were left to manage themselves
as best they could between periodic rads by slavers. When the Zultani
mastership was broken, the populace of T'Batak was left alone for nearly 50
years. When recontact was once again attempted, the population was found to
have a religious fear of "Sky Devils." Any commercial exchanges must be done so
as to disguise the origin of off-world trade goods. An orbital monitor warns
all incoming ships of the situation. The Krmyia Einarchy would like to have the
inhabitants develop culturally as independently as possible.
T'Batak is the third planet in a system of six. The first planet is a minor
rock with 2100 km diameter. The second orbital position is occupied by an
asteroid belt. The fourth orbital position is occupied by a second asteroid
belt. The fifth planet is a Gas Giant with 6 minor satellites. The sixth
orbital position is occupied by a frozen rock with stats of X510000--.

system.name: Cham
system.comment:
World: Cham
Subsector: T'Shemi
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 2528 (L0108)
UWP: A5579C9-D

Allegiance: K'Chemi Centralate
Bases: Navy
Trade Codes: Cx              
Travel Zone: Green

Cham is the Capital of the K'Chemi Centralate.

system.name: Vya
system.comment:
World: Vya
Subsector: T'Shemi
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 2921 (L0501)
UWP: A557734-C

Allegiance: Stazmi Zanya
Bases: Navy
Trade Codes: None
Travel Zone: Green

Vya is the Capital of the Stasmi Zanya.

system.name: Kalocsa
system.comment:
World: Kalocsa
Subsector: T'Shemi
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 3121 (L0701)
UWP: X7A6000--

Allegiance: Stazmi Zanya
Trade Codes: None
Travel Zone: Green

One of the two undeveloped systems claimed by Stasmi Zanya, this planet is the
subject of a long-term terraforming project. It is the second planet in a
system of eight. The inner planet is a minor rock of 1500 km diameter. The
third orbit is occupied by an asteroid belt. The fourth planet is a small Gas
Giant with four minor moons. The fifth planet is a large Gas Giant with twelve
moons. The sixth, seventh, and eighth planets are minor rocks, all less than
2000 km diameter.
This planet would have been a prime candidate for colonisation had it not had
an atmospheric component which had a carcinogenic effect on Humans. A special
attempt to alter the composition of the atmosphere by biological means was
made. Special organisms were "tailored" to change the carcinogen into a
harmless compound and released into the atmosphere. Several monitoring
satellites were placed in orbit by the various universities and companies
involved in the project. Each satellite is periodically tapped for its
information. The project started one hundred years ago. The organisms are
working, and the carcinogens are being removed, although not at the anticipated
rate. The organisms are not as efficient as first predicted. They have reduced
the carcinogen concentration to a much lower figure than previously, however.
Humans can now survive on the surface with only a light breath filter for as
long as six months. The experiment is considered a scientific success but not
quiet a commercial success by the parties involved.

system.name: Rn'Matam
system.comment:
World: Rn'Matam
Subsector: T'Shemi
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 3228 (L0808)
UWP: B4578A9-B

Allegiance: Tarquiri' Comate
Bases: Scout
Trade Codes: None
Travel Zone: Green

This planet is a port of some significance on one of the major commercial
routes of the Taquari' Comnate. It hosts a Scout base at which are stationed
the scouting patrols for the area. Rn'Matam is the third planet in a system of
seven. The first and second orbital positions are occupied by planets with
stats of X300000-- and E491200-A. The fourth position is occupied by an
asteroid belt. Fifth and sixth are large gas giants with eight and ten
satellites respectively. The seventh planet is a frozen rock less the 2000 km 
in diameter.
Rn'Matam, as its name indicates, owes allegiance to Branch Rn'. It was settled
five centuries ago as part of a deliberate expansion of Rn' influence into the
border areas. Agricultural development was emphasised at first, but efforts in
this area were not productive due to native crop diseases. Capital for
industrial expansion was lacking, and the colony stagnated for two centuries.
Within the last century, a program of financial reorganisation within Branch
Rn' has produced enough capital to invest in industrial development. Over the
next five decades, this industrial program will be completed, bringing the
planet almost up to primary industrial status.
Rn' is also encouraging immigration of the Cekhktl, a minor rave of amphibious
crustacean gatherer descent. Cekhktl societies have proven especially skilled
in aquatic agriculture. It is anticipated that this cooperative venture will
greatly increase agricultural production by making use of the extensive, and
hereto unexploited, shallow sea areas. Plans are in hand to expand the starport
to A classification within the next 20 years.

system.name: Bafq
system.comment:
World: Bafq
Subsector: Yakilnet
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 0732 (M0702)
UWP: A788999-B

Allegiance: Zultanate Al Amyi
Bases: Navy
Trade Codes: Cx              
Travel Zone: Green

Bafq is the Capital of the Zultanate Al Amyi.

system.name: Gadag
system.comment:
World: Gadag
Subsector: Dawes
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 1632 (N0802)
UWP: D447202-8

Allegiance: Ramayan
Trade Codes: Ni              
Travel Zone: Green

The third planet in a system of six, this 7200 km diameter world has only
recently begun to be developed. The first orbit is occupied by several minor
chunks of debris; none are as large as 100 kilometers in diameter, and they are
too few to be called an asteroid belt. The second planet is a barren rock,
stats X300000--. The fourth planet is X321000--. the fifth planet is a large
Gas Giant with six minor moons. The sixth planet is a frozen rock, stats
X310000--.
Two centuries ago, a mineral survey update indicated valuable deposits of light
metals on one of the continents. An automated mining station was set up and a
small colony established. It has not proven worthwhile to expand the colony
because plenty of land is still available on other, more developed planets. The
deposits have shown no signs of playing out and continue to produce a nice
profit.

system.name: Nagercoil
system.comment:
World: Nagercoil
Subsector: Dawes
Sector: Maranantha-Alkahest
Coordinates: 1634 (N0804)
UWP: A5468A3-C

Allegiance: Ramayan
Bases: None
Trade Codes: None
Travel Zone: Green

The Ramayan Capital is located at Nagercoil.
